poem:
Title: "Pay Equality on the Airwaves"

Oh, bold BBC, your disc of world renowned, 
How it spins, perimeter revealing faces of scorn.
Equal pay, a right, in tribunal entwined.
Croxall, Giannone, Madera and McVeigh,
These names, a chorus in the anthem of justice.
Muffled by the merger, their fiery mics adorn. 
For in the studio of disparity, inequality is born.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Tribunal excludes equal pay from female presenters’ claim against BBC Four female BBC presenters who have taken legal action against their employer will not be able to include equal pay as part of their claim, an employment tribunal has ruled. Martine Croxall, Karin Giannone, Kasia Madera and Annita McVeigh have accused the broadcaster of conducting a “sham recruitment exercise” after they lost their jobs when the BBC merged its domestic and global news channels last". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
